jgame

Interface GAnimatable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GButton, GContainer, GParallax, GParallax.GTiledSprite, GSprite

    public interface GAnimatable
    Any animated object that can go to the next and previous frames.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isPlaying()
      Determines whether or not the animation is currently playing.
      void nextFrame()
      Advances this object to the next frame.
      void previousFrame()
      Takes this object to the previous frame.
      void setFrameNumber(int frameNumber)
      Takes this object to the specified frame number.
      void setPlaying(boolean playing)
      Sets whether or not the animation is currently playing.

    • Method Detail

      • isPlaying

        boolean isPlaying()
        Determines whether or not the animation is currently playing. The default value is true.
        Returns:
        true if the animation is playing, or false if it is not

      • nextFrame

        void nextFrame()
        Advances this object to the next frame.

        If the animation is already on the last frame, it will loop from the first frame.

        If the animation contains no frames, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        If the animation is not playing, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

      • previousFrame

        void previousFrame()
        Takes this object to the previous frame.

        If the animation is already on the first frame, it will loop from the last frame.

        If the animation contains no frames, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        If the animation is not playing, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

      • setFrameNumber

        void setFrameNumber(int frameNumber)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Takes this object to the specified frame number.
        Parameters:
        frameNumber - the new frame number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the frame number is out of bounds for this animation

      • setPlaying

        void setPlaying(boolean playing)
        Sets whether or not the animation is currently playing. The default value is true.
        Parameters:
        playing - true if the animation should play, or false if it should not
